name: places/ChIJfZNdtZZZwokRUnWD0-pMMyo
formattedAddress: 117 Waverly Pl, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 117 Waverly Pl, New York, NY 10011-9182, USA

originalText.text:
I have never dealt with people who are so incompetent, irresponsible and flat out despicable. Repairs take WEEKS if not MONTHS. From the fridge to the toilet to the locks to the pipes-- it's just one broken p.o.s. after the other. The front door to the Standard Realty building has also been repeatedly broken for the year that I have lived here. The FRONT DOOR! These people do not care about the safety of their tenants. When you call the office to request a service, the employees are incredibly rude, they blame the tenant for anything that goes wrong.

But I would like to share my experience that I believe shows the complete moral corruptness of this company: As my lease is ending, the company is allowed to enter my apt to show it to prospective renters (this is in the lease) IF I AM NOT THERE TO LET THEM IN. I was explicitly told this by Kenny. A Standard Realty employee (Patrick) entered my apartment without buzzing and opened my bedroom door without knocking. I was sleeping, naked. Believe me I always wake up from the buzzer and I definitely would have woken up from a knock at the bedroom door. When I called the office to report it, Denise told me they had every right to do what they did and told me I was "behaving like a crazy person" for being angry that I was violated in my own home. How is this allowed to happen?? I can't believe how insensitive and uncaring this woman is. I would have thought that as a woman she would understand how that must feel.

Avoid this company like the plague. They have zero consideration for tenants and their comfort and space. All they care about is money. Saving money by keeping the building in disrepair, and keeping the money flowing by finding new unsuspecting renters-- even if that means violating a current tenant's space.

originalText.text: well love is a strong word for a landlord, but i have been living in a building of thiers for about 6 years now and im plenty happy here. but the situation for finding a decent aprtment in new york sucks. when i got the apartment i noticed they have a wide range of units, some were not so nice whereas i chose to pay for and live in a nicer more renovated one

originalText.text: Previous tenant with Standard Realty. Poor customer service, took months to get deposit back and hung up the phone multiple times when asking for updates. I’m surprised they are still in business.

text.text: Previous tenant with Standard Realty. Poor customer service, took months to get deposit back and hung up the phone multiple times when asking for updates. I’m surprised they are still in business.
